% -------------------------------------------------------
% Table of Spherical Harmonics (Real-Valued, Simplified)
% Generated by Achates (ChatGPT) in collaboration with Daniel
% Date-Time Group (DTG): Tue Dec 17 19:40:53 MST 2024 (approximation)
% -------------------------------------------------------

\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{amsmath, amssymb}
\usepackage{geometry}
\usepackage{pdflscape}
\geometry{margin=1in}

% -------------------------------------------------------
% Comment on Normalization
% The spherical harmonics are normalized with a factor of 2sqrt(pi),
% leading to a clean representation. The terms are separable into 
% Theta(theta) and Phi(phi), where:
% - Theta(theta) represents the angular dependence in polar coordinates.
% - Phi(phi) represents the azimuthal dependence.
% Opposite-sign harmonics are defined by symmetry: Y_n^{-m} = -Y_n^{m}.
% -------------------------------------------------------

% Degree 0
\newcommand{\shmazerozero}{\frac{1}{2}} % Y_0^0

% Degree 1
\newcommand{\shmaonezero}{\sqrt{3} \cos\theta} % Y_1^0
\newcommand{\shmaoneoneminus}{\sqrt{3} \sin\theta \sin\phi} % Y_1^{-1}
\newcommand{\shmaoneoneplus}{-\shmaoneoneminus} % Y_1^1

% Degree 2
\newcommand{\shmatwozero}{\frac{\sqrt{5}}{4} \left(1 + \cos(2\theta)\right)} % Y_2^0
\newcommand{\shmatwoone}{\sqrt{15} \sin\theta \cos\theta \sin\phi} % Y_2^{-1}
\newcommand{\shmatwooneplus}{-\shmatwoone} % Y_2^1
\newcommand{\shmatwotwominus}{\frac{\sqrt{15}}{4} \sin^2\theta \sin(2\phi)} % Y_2^{-2}
\newcommand{\shmatwotwoplus}{-\shmatwotwominus} % Y_2^2

% Degree 3
\newcommand{\shmathreezero}{\frac{\sqrt{7}}{8} \left(3\cos\theta + 5\cos(3\theta)\right)} % Y_3^0
\newcommand{\shmathreeoneminus}{\frac{\sqrt{21}}{4} \left(3\sin\theta - \sin(3\theta)\right) \sin\phi} % Y_3^{-1}
\newcommand{\shmathreeoneplus}{-\shmathreeoneminus} % Y_3^1
\newcommand{\shmathreetwominus}{\frac{\sqrt{105}}{4} \sin(2\theta) \cos\theta \sin(2\phi)} % Y_3^{-2}
\newcommand{\shmathreetwoplus}{-\shmathreetwominus} % Y_3^2
\newcommand{\shmathreethreeminus}{\frac{\sqrt{35}}{4} \sin^3\theta \sin(3\phi)} % Y_3^{-3}
\newcommand{\shmathreethreeplus}{-\shmathreethreeminus} % Y_3^3

% Degree 4 (Example extension)
\newcommand{\shmafourzero}{\frac{3\sqrt{5}}{16} \left(1 - 4\cos(2\theta) + \cos(4\theta)\right)} % Y_4^0

% Degree 5-10: Systematically extend...
% Example for Degree 5, m = -3:
\newcommand{\shmafivethreeminus}{\frac{\sqrt{385}}{16} \left(5\sin\theta - 10\sin(3\theta) + \sin(5\theta)\right) \sin(3\phi)}
\newcommand{\shmafivethreeplus}{-\shmafivethreeminus}

% -------------------------------------------------------
% Add terms for m = 4, ..., 10 (systematically expand here)
% -------------------------------------------------------

\begin{document}
\begin{landscape}
\scriptsize
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.8}
\setlength{\tabcolsep}{8pt}

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{lccccccccccc}
\textbf{\( n \)} & \textbf{\( m = -10 \)} & ... & \textbf{\( m = -1 \)} & \textbf{\( m = 0 \)} & \textbf{\( m = 1 \)} & ... & \textbf{\( m = 10 \)} \\ \hline
0 &  &  &  & $\shmazerozero$ &  &  &  \\
1 &  &  & $\shmaoneoneminus$ & $\shmaonezero$ & $\shmaoneoneplus$ &  &  \\
2 &  & $\shmatwotwominus$ & $\shmatwoone$ & $\shmatwozero$ & $\shmatwooneplus$ & $\shmatwotwoplus$ &  \\
3 & $\shmathreethreeminus$ & $\shmathreetwominus$ & $\shmathreeoneminus$ & $\shmathreezero$ & $\shmathreeoneplus$ & $\shmathreetwoplus$ & $\shmathreethreeplus$ \\
% Add rows systematically for n = 4 through 10
\end{tabular}
\end{center}
\end{landscape}

\end{document}
